investigation.title: Radiation-induced bystander effects and gene expression in cells deficient for RAD9
investigation.description: Background: The radiation bystander response is an important component of the overall response of cells to radiation and critical to understanding health risks of radiation exposure to humans. The mechanism of radiation response includes inter-cellular signaling and intra-cellular communication by which the bystander signal is propagated.

project.funding: This study was supported by NIH grants CA049062, CA130536 and GM079107

publications.title: RAD9 deficiency enhances radiation induced bystander DNA damage and transcriptomal response.
publications.summary: RAD9 deficiency enhances radiation induced bystander DNA damage and transcriptomal response. — 10.1186/1748-717X-9-206

parameters.ionizing radiation device or source: Radiological Research Accelerator Facility of Columbia University
